content.question: In an experiment, a variable net force is applied to an object. A graph of the net force exerted on the object as a function of time is shown. Which of the following experiments could have been conducted to represent the variable net force shown in the graph?

choices.label: A <math alttext="0.2 kilogram " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object increases its speed from <math alttext="2 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="8 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

A <math alttext="1 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object increases its speed from <math alttext="2 meter per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="4 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>4</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

A <math alttext="2 kilograms " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object increases its speed from <math alttext="1 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="3 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>3</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

A <math alttext="3 kilograms " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>3</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object increases its speed from <math alttext="0 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="1 meter per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: A <math alttext="3 kilograms " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>3</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object increases its speed from <math alttext="0 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="1 meter per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
